page.title: 01Twixt Tarset & Tyne
page.content: This beautiful rural area comprises heather and bent moorland grazed by sheep and suckler cows, naturally wooded slopes, enclosed fields growing grass, hay silage or arable crops bounded by dry stone walls and burns tubling to the main river valley. The most attractive parts are accessible only on foot. There are the hamlets of Greenhaugh, Lanehead and Greystead and scattered farms and cottages. The farms are family run employing casual labour at busy times. A few people work in forestry or seasonally on Kielder Water. Others travel to work out of the area. Young people mostly leave to find work. Otherwise the population is fairly stable. Though sparsely populated, there is a lively community spirit centred on the school, the village hall and the pubs.
